qas.question: In what year was Paul VI beautified?
On what day was Paul VI born?
Whose liturgical feast is celebrated on the 26th of September?
On what day was the beautification ceremony performed for Paul VI?
What was attributed to Paul VI and officially approved on May 9, 2014?

context: On 20 December 2012, Pope Benedict XVI, in an audience with the Cardinal Prefect of the Congregation for the Causes of Saints, declared that the late pontiff had lived a life of heroic virtue, which means that he could be called "Venerable". <a4_0>A miracle<a4_0/> attributed to the intercession of Paul VI was approved on 9 May <a0_0>2014<a0_0/> by Pope Francis. The beatification ceremony for <a2_0>Paul VI<a2_0/> was held on <a3_0>19 October<a3_0/> 2014, which means that he can now be called "Blessed". His liturgical feast day is celebrated on the date of his birth, <a1_0>26 September<a1_0/>, rather than the day of his death as is usual.
